title: 2 Simple Ways to Clear Safari Search History

steps.title: Open your device's Settings.
steps.content: Open your device's Settings. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and click the Safari app.
steps.content: Scroll down and click the Safari app. This looks like a compass with a blue and white background. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Clear History and Website Data.
steps.content: Click Clear History and Website Data . This will be labeled in blue text. You can find this underneath Privacy & Security . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Clear History and Data to confirm.
steps.content: Click Clear History and Data to confirm. The text will be in red. [4] X Research source This will remove all history, cookies, and other browsing data from Safari.

steps.title: Toggle "Search Engine Suggestions" and "Safari Suggestions" off.
steps.content: Toggle "Search Engine Suggestions" and "Safari Suggestions" off. This will disable the feature that automatically inputs search suggestions. If you choose to leave this on, Safari will suggest searches more often as your browser history builds.

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. You'll be able to delete your recent searches from within the Safari browser. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click History.
steps.content: Click History . You can find this on the toolbar on top of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Clear History….
steps.content: Click Clear History… . [7] X Research source

steps.title: Choose a timeframe you want to clear.
steps.content: Choose a timeframe you want to clear. [8] X Research source You can choose: the last hour , today , today and yesterday , or all history .

steps.title: Click Clear History.
steps.content: Click Clear History . This will remove all history, cookies, and other browsing data from Safari. [9] X Research source

steps.title: On the top toolbar, click Preferences.
steps.content: On the top toolbar, click Preferences . [10] X Research source

steps.title: Uncheck "Include search engine suggestions".
steps.content: Uncheck "Include search engine suggestions". This will stop Safari from sending you search suggestions as you type. If you choose to leave this on, Safari will suggest searches more often as your browser history builds.

steps.title: Turn off Screen Time.
steps.content: Turn off Screen Time. If you have iOS 12 or later, Screen Time may put restrictions on Safari, which can cause issues when clearing browsing data. [11] X Research source Go to Settings → Screen Time → Turn Off Screen Time . You can turn Screen Time back on after you have successfully cleared your history.

steps.title: Disable iCloud syncing for Safari.
steps.content: Disable iCloud syncing for Safari. iCloud may store your browsing history, bookmarks, and reading lists. This could cause some browser history to reappear after clearing it. For iOS, go to Settings , then click your Apple ID . Click iCloud and toggle Safari off. For Mac, go to System Preferences → iCloud . Uncheck the box for Safari . Clear your Safari history following the steps above.

steps.title: Restart your device.
steps.content: Restart your device. You may need to restart your device to clear your history properly. To restart an iPhone without a home button, press and hold the lock button and top volume button for at least five seconds. Slide to power off. After a few minutes, hold the power button to turn it on. [12] X Research source To restart an iPhone with a home button, press and hold the lock button and home button for at least five seconds. Slide to power off. After a few minutes, hold the power button to turn it on. [13] X Research source To restart a Mac , click the Apple icon in the top left. In the drop-down menu, click Restart… . It will power on again automatically. [14] X Research source
